result.execSummary:
The defendant Lyman H Faber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lyman H Faber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lyman H Faber was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed, in ct 2 the enhancer use of a dangerous weapon is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes $50 fine plus costs, $100 DV surcharge, deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge, bond applied, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.
Amended - And demand for discovery -filed by ADA J Phan.
